methodology: Systematic web searches conducted for each hospital to find credible evidence of ASR certification from Joint Commission, DNV, or state department of health. Only hospitals with confirmed web evidence marked as verified.
notes: Washington State operates a Level III stroke designation system as part of their Emergency Cardiac and Stroke (ECS) System. WA DOH analysis indicates 44 hospitals designated as Level III. Idaho operates a similar TSE (Time Sensitive Emergency) Level 3 designation. Alaska hospitals showed no public evidence of ASR certification. Many hospitals could not be verified due to lack of publicly available certification information.

alaska_hospitals.notes: No Alaska hospitals showed public evidence of ASR certification. All are Critical Access Hospitals, some are UW Telestroke partners.

idaho_hospitals.notes: Idaho uses TSE (Time Sensitive Emergency) Level 3 designation equivalent to ASR. 3 hospitals confirmed: Boundary Community Hospital, Clearwater Valley Hospital, and St Mary's Hospital.

washington_hospitals.notes: Washington State has Emergency Cardiac and Stroke (ECS) System with Level III designation. 9 hospitals verified with credible evidence. 2 hospitals (Multicare Valley, Quincy Valley MC) have higher certifications than ASR. Many hospitals listed in WA DOH analysis but lacking independent verification from Joint Commission or DNV.

recommendations: For Washington hospitals, direct contact with WA DOH Emergency Cardiac and Stroke System is recommended to obtain official Level III designation list. Many hospitals appear to participate in WA State's system but lack Joint Commission or DNV ASR certification. For Alaska hospitals, direct contact with hospitals or Alaska DHSS is needed as no public ASR certification information was found.
